featuredShowsList.showText: Indiana was the assistant director on Titus Andronicus directed by Jude Christian, playing at the Sam Wannamaker Theatre (Shakespeare's Globe) January to April 2023. As the candles burn and the bodies pile up, director Jude Christian explores the macabre madness that takes us to the edge of humanity.

featuredShowsList.showText: This is a new devised play about hidden disabilities based on Indiana's own life experiences. With aspects of forum theatre, she helped create the script which focussed on educating children on seizure awareness and first aid, as well as other issues around hidden disabilities. The show was funded by South Western Railway and toured to 25 schools in three weeks.

featuredShowsList.showTitle: The Tales of Hans Christian Andersen
featuredShowsList.showText: Indiana was the Movement director and Choreographer for a new adaptation of 'The Tales of Hans Christian Andersen' which played at St Nicholas Church, Guildford in autumn 2021. The Ugly Duckling, Thumbelina, The Little Match-Girl, The Emperor's New Clothes, The Princess and the Pea: the tales of Hans Christian Andersen are some of the most-treasured stories we have all grown up with, and this Autumn we're bringing seven of them to life in a brand new musical. https://www.guildford-shakespeare-company.co.uk/hans-andersen/

currentWorkList.currentWorkText: Indiana is currently Associate Director on A Midsummer Night's Dream directed by Elle While and featuring Shakespeare’s Globe’s Artistic Director Michelle Terry as Puck. On Midsummer’s eve, four rebellious young lovers, a band of ambitious artisan players, and a feuding Fairy King and Queen all cross paths in a riotously enchanted forest. When the shapeshifting, mischief-making Puck, the Fairy King’s servant, is ordered to cast spells on everyone, what could possibly go wrong?  All hell breaks loose as nature, and human nature, are turned upside down and inside out; the forest’s new inhabitants are in for a wild and unsettling night of love, jealousy and utter confusion… but once the nightmare is over, will life be a dream again by morning?

currentWorkImages.workImageAlt: A Midsummer Night's Dream poster featuring Michelle Terry as Puck with leaves and flowers in her hair.

currentWorkList.currentWorkText: Indiana is currently Movement Director on Guildford Shakespeare’s summer season production of Henry V, directed by Caroline Devlin. The once wild Prince Hal is now King; eager to prove himself. The French, even his own soldiers, question his readiness to lead. His response? To unite his country in a blistering campaign that will defy the odds and change the course of history.

currentWorkList.currentWorkText: The Solid Life Of Sugar Water by Jack Thorne is currently playing at The Orange Tree Theatre in Richmond until the 12th November. The Solid Life of Sugar Water is a beautifully told, witty and impassioned personal story. It also amplifies disabled voices as an integral part of the play, and provides representation of a community that often goes unseen and unheard.      Please find more information on the show below.  https://orangetreetheatre.co.uk/whats-on/the-solid-life-of-sugar-water/about

otherCredits: Other credits include: Associate Director on A Midsummer Night’s Dream (Shakespeare's Globe) Assistant Director on Titus Andronicus and Julius Caesar (Shakespeare’s Globe); Movement Director on The Tales of Hans Christian Andersen (GSC); Associate Director on The Light at the Piazza (In Concert, Alexandra Palace Theatre), Merrily We Roll Along (Yvonne Arnaud Theatre); Assistant Director on All’s Well That Ends Well (Jermyn Street Theatre/GSC), Cinderella (Yvonne Arnaud Theatre); A Woman Alone (Etcetera Theatre); All Aboard (Electric Theatre); Language coach on Strictly Ballroom the Musical (Leeds Playhouse). Indiana was the assistant director and producer at the Guildford Shakespeare Company (2019-2021) where she assisted on As You Like It, She Stoops to Conquer, The Merry Wives of Windsor, Twelfth Night, Robin Hood, Alice and Wonderland, Romeo and Juliet, The Legend of King Arthur and Associate Director on Macbeth.
directorCredits: Indiana Lown-Collins is currently Resident Associate Director at Shakespeare's Globe. She won the 2022 JMK Young Director's Award with her production of ‘The Solid Life Of Sugar Water’ by Jack Thorne staged at the Orange Tree Theatre. Directing credits include: The Solid Life Of Sugar Water (Orange Tree Theatre), Romeo and Juliet (Guildford Shakespeare Company), The Purple Princess (GSC) and The Last Supper (Fresh Direction ‘Replay Project’ The Young Vic).
aboutMeText: Hello! I'm Indiana (she/her), I'm a theatre director and currently Resident Associate Director at Shakespeare’s Globe. I am the 2022 winner of the JMK Award with my production, ‘The Solid Life of Sugar Water’ by Jack Thorne which played at the Orange Tree Theatre Oct/Nov 22 and won the OFFIE for 'Best Production'. As a disabled artist I am passionate about making theatre that’s representative of the world we live in, that champions unheard voices and that is authentic and raw. I am committed to trying to change the theatre landscape to represent the disabled community more widely in the arts. I want to make Theatre that puts disabled voices at the centre of the story. I started working professionally as a director in 2016 and have had the privilege of working with new writing, Shakespeare and musicals across a number of different and exciting venues. From 2018-2021 I worked as the assistant director and producer at The Guildford Shakespeare Company working on site specific theatre.
